model_input:
[Task Description]
You will be given DIALOGUE CONTEXT and MEMORY.
Your job is to judge if MEMORY contains helpful past information for a language model, representing Unknown, to generate a proper next response based on DIALOGUE CONTEXT.

If the DIALOUGE CONTEXT does not require the model to utilize past information for response generation, say "N/A".
Say "Yes" if MEMORY contains such helpful information and say "No" if it dose not.
Provide a brief explanation for your judgement.

[Format Regulation]
Generate your output below OUTPUT using the following format:
Brief explanation: your explanation
Judgement: "Yes", "No", or "N/A"

[Task]
DIALOGUE CONTEXT:
I have plan to make garden in my home. I want some suggestion from you.
Plum trees and pair trees would be my suggestion in the summer when they blossom they have such a lovely flower on them
IN MY HOME?! A TREE? That was not at all what I was thinking. Do they grow well indoors? I am intrigued. 
Well if you want to make it like a proper garden experience then I would suggest going all in, and go for the best most authentic looking items you could get 
Wow! Ok! This is sounding like a bigger undertaking! Should I embrace bugs in the home if they help the plants or am I getting wild?
Well from my experince bugs do the complete opposite and don't help at all, so avoid that at all costs! Fertilizers are the way to go to help with growth.
Oh man. I have lots to learn. What is the lifespan of a plum tree?
around 10 to 15 years but if you take care of them I'm sure you could get 20 out of it.
Now we are also talking commitment! This is not how I expected my day to go! I am excited, yet so nervous!

[MEMORY]
Related Evidences: (1) {'Related Topics': 'Gardening and Survival in Space', 'Related Summaries': 'Discussion on gardening, plant survival in space, and the possibility of using weeds for space travel.', 'Related Dialogues': '### Speaker A: What plants do you think would be able to survive a space trip best? ### Speaker B: Hmmm, maybe the weeds growing in my backyard, haha. Those things are impossible to kill, and I bet they could survive a space trip. ### Speaker A: You are probably right!
